data.title: General for Mobility and Transport, European Commission
data.text:
Henrik Hololei

Director-General for Mobility and Transport, European Commission

Moderator: Jeff Shane, former General Counsel, International Air Transport Association; former Undersecretary for Policy, U.S. Department of Transportation

Cost

Members: No charge for current IAC members to participate in this program.

Nonmembers: $25 (Not a member? Click here to join)

Note: We are using the Zoom webinar platform to deliver this program. Attendees can access via the Zoom app or a browser. Access information will be sent upon registration.

About the Speaker

Henrik Hololei is an economist by training and holds degrees from Tallinn Technical University and Aarhus University in Denmark.

He held various positions in the Estonian Government Office between 1995 and 2004. He was mainly responsible for coordinating the work for the Estonian accession to the European Union, working directly with the Government and Prime Minister.

In 2001-2002 he was Minister of Economy. In 2002-2003 he represented the Estonian Government in the Convention on the Future of Europe.

In 2004 he moved to the European Commission as Head of Cabinet of Vice President Siim Kallas. Mr. Kallas' first mandate 2004-2010 dealt with Administration, Audit and Anti-Fraud while during his second mandate he was responsible for Transport.

From November 2013 he was Deputy Secretary General of the European Commission.
